Big Screen British Comedy (1971 - 1977) - Imprint Collection #78 - 81 quantity

Number of Blu-ray Discs

4

Rating

PG

Runtime (in minutes)

388

Product Code IMP2767

Three of the most popular and long-running BBC comedy series hit the BIG SCREEN in four film adaptations featuring the original casts – Dad’s Army, Steptoe & Son, Steptoe & Son Ride Again, Are You Being Served? – three appearing on Blu-ray for the first time.

Three of the most popular and long-running BBC comedy series hit the BIG SCREEN in four film adaptations featuring the original casts – Dad’s Army, Steptoe & Son, Steptoe & Son Ride Again, Are You Being Served? – three appearing on blu-ray for the first time.

Limited 4 Disc Hardbox edition With Unique Artwork. 1500 copies only.

Dad’s Army (1971) – Imprint Collection #78

Starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn, John Laurie, James Beck, Arnold Ridley, Ian Lavender, Bill Pertwee, Frank Williams

Britain: 1939. Walmington-on-Sea. The defense of this tranquil coastal town is in the hands of bank manager Captain Mainwaring when he assembles a motley platoon to become the Home Guard.

The 1971 big-screen film version of the much-loved and long-running BBC comedy series.

Special Features and Technical Specs:

1080p high-definition transfer presented in the original as-exhibited aspect ratio

Audio commentary by Tony Pritchard & Paul Carpenter of the Dad’s Army Appreciation Society (2021)

Frank Williams on Dad’s Army (2021)

Walmington on Screen – interview with editor Willy Kemplen (2021)

Arthur Lowe radio interview extract (1976)

Open House – interview with writer Jimmy Perry & actor Bill Pertwee (1998)

Pelican Crossing – 2 Road Safety films featuring the Dad’s Army cast

Don’t Panic! – Road Safety film featuring actor Clive Dunn

Locations Photo Gallery

Textless Titles

Isolated Music & Effects audio track

Theatrical Trailer

LPCM 2.0 Mono

Optional English subtitles

Steptoe & Son (1972) – Imprint Collection #79

Starring Harry H. Corbett, Wilfrid Brambell, and Carolyn Seymour

The bright lights of the West End beckon for Harold when he marries a stripper, but his ever-resentful father tags along on their honeymoon bringing an end to wedded bliss.

The 1972 big-screen film version of the much-loved and long-running BBC comedy series.

Special Features and Technical Specs:

1080p high-definition transfer

Audio commentary by television historian Dick Fiddy (2021)

Interview with Harry H. Corbett from Today (1975)

Interview with Ray Galton and Alan Simpson (2013)

Textless Titles

Theatrical Trailer

Photo Gallery

LPCM 2.0 Mono

Optional English subtitles

Booklet reproduction of the film’s original pressbook

Steptoe & Son Ride Again (1973) – Imprint Collection #80

Starring Harry H. Corbett, Wilfrid Brambell, and Diana Dors

The Steptoe’s loyal, but past-it horse must be sent off to the knacker’s yard. Instead of buying a new nag, a drunken Harold blows their savings on a greyhound in the belief it will win them a fortune.

The 1973 big screen sequel based on the much-loved and long-running BBC comedy series.

Special Features and Technical Specs:

1080p high-definition transfer

Audio commentary by comedy historian Robert Ross and Gemma Fanning (2021)

On-set interview excerpts from BBC’s Nationwide (1973)

Comedy Makers – excerpt from a 1970s Dutch television documentary featuring rehearsal footage from episode “Men of Property” & interview with Ray Galton & Alan Simpson

Steptoe & Son Down Under – album recording from the Australian stage show (1977)

Textless Titles

Theatrical Trailer

Isolated Music & Effects audio track

Photo Gallery

LPCM 2.0 Mono

Optional English subtitles

Booklet reproduction of the film’s original pressbook

Are You Being Served? (1977) – Imprint Collection #81

Starring Mollie Sugden, John Inman, Frank Thornton, Trevor Bannister, Wendy Richard, Arthur Brough, Nicholas Smith, Andrew Sachs, Harold Bennett

The staff of Grace Bros. Ladies and Gentlemen’s department head to the sun-kissed shores of the Costa Plonka for the holiday of a lifetime while the store is redecorated.

The 1977 big screen film version of the much-loved and long-running BBC comedy series.

Special Features and Technical Specs:
